original: Klingspor, Carl Wilhelm Orozoo, friherre, hov jägmästare, Hellekis säteri, Råbäck, f. 6/10/80 i Gbg av hovmarskalk., frih. Carl K. o. frih:an Louise Silfverschiöild. Ind. 06-07, i Marocko o. Spam. 14. Ryttm. i Livreg. hus. res. 17, hov-jägm. 26. V. ordf., sederm. ordf. i Skarab. 1. jordbr :fören. 11-34 samt underhand! :deleg., ordf. i Sv. lantbr :tj :m :fören. avd. f. Skarab. 1. 21-34, häradsdom. 31, ordf. i Medelplana komm :full’m., komm:stämma o. fattig-v:styr., i Kinnekullekrets. av SvRK 21-47, ordf. o. v. verkst. led. i styr. f. Skarab. 1. i Sv. fattigv :förb. 25-38, styr:led. i bl. a. Korsnäs Sågv. A-B, Skånska Cement A-B, Ställbergs Grufve A-B, led. av Johanniterordens i iSv:e konv. 41, andre v. ordf. 47, att. v. sv. leg. i S:t Petersburg 08. KVO-2lkl, RNO, R-RJohO, BMilK2kl, KFinlVRO, RRS :tSt03kl, SvRKGM 46, LLA.
translated: Klingspor, Carl Wilhelm Orozoo, Baron, court gamekeeper, Hellekis Manor, Råbäck, born on October 6th, 1880 in Gothenburg, to Court Marshal, Baron Carl K. and Baroness Louise Silfverschiöild. Married on the 15th with Baroness Brita Ramieil. Children: Carl-Gustaf born in 1916, assistant manager at Råbäcks Bruk, Stig born in 1922, student of philosophy at Uppsala University. Passed the officer exam in 1903. Studied in Egypt, Russia, and the Caucasus in 1904, in British India in 1906-1907, in Morocco and Spain in 1914. Cavalryman in the Life Regiment Hussars from 1917, court gamekeeper from 1926. Vice chairman and later chairman of the Skaraborg County Agricultural Society from 1911 to 1934, as well as delegate and chairman of the Swedish Agricultural Services Association in Skaraborg County from 1921 to 1934. District judge in 1931, chairman of the Medelplana municipal council, municipal meeting, and poor relief board. Member of the Kinnekulle District of the Swedish Red Cross Society from 1921 to 1947, chairman and executive leader of the A-B Kinnevik board, chairman of Kinne, Kinne-fjärding, and Kållands County Court House board since 1922, of the Mösseberg Water Spa board, Swedish Suchard A-B, and other companies and associations. Representative for Skaraborg County in the Swedish Poor Relief Association from 1925 to 1938, board member of, among others, Korsnäs Sawmill A-B, Skåne Cement A-B, Ställberg Mines A-B, member of the Swedish branch of the Johanniter Order since 1941, deputy vice chairman since 1947, attached to the Swedish legation in St. Petersburg in 1908. Knight of the Order of the Seraphim, Knight of the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Knight of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Order of the Cross of Liberty (Finland), Knight of the Order of St. Stanislaus, 3rd Class (Russia), Grand Master of the Royal Swedish Red Cross Society in 1946, and member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Agriculture and Forestry.
